meanings.definition: To strongly encourage or urge someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The coach was exhorting the team to give their best effort in the game.
meanings.sent2: She was exhorting her friend to follow her dreams and not give up.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started exhorting the cat to chase its own tail, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker was exhorting the audience to climb the mountain of success.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's words were exhorting the students to reach for the stars and never give up.

meanings.sent1: The wise old man was exhorting the young travelers to beware of the dangers ahead.
meanings.sent2: She exhortingly warned her sister not to trust strangers in the city.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel exhorting the birds to watch out for the mischievous raccoon was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse stood tall, exhorting ships to steer clear of the treacherous rocks.
meanings.sent5: The weathered sign exhorting hikers to be cautious on the slippery trail was a reminder of safety.
